attributes.comment:
It been 6 years in this country on H1B visa and I recently renewed my 3rd term
on H1B. Priority Dates are so far behind that it is taking close to 6 -8 years
for one eligible skilled worker to get a permanant resident status. Our
democratic govt doesnt want to provide any input on increasing the processing
time for one to get his or her permanant status and want to increase fees in
every sector.

In one way our government want more skilled workers to come to US and share
their knowledge and expertise in short want to propose to increase the number of
H1 B quota. Secondly they want to propose to increase the filing fees to get H1B
visa making it much harder for companies to find a worker as the financial
burden is going to worsen this process more than solving it.

Anonymous
Houston Texas
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
